lead_paragraph: Freddy Adu scored three goals and the United States recovered from an early deficit to defeat Poland, 6-1, yesterday in Montreal in the most lopsided result so far at the Under-20 World Cup.Danny Szetela, whose parents were born in Poland, scored twice and Red Bulls striker Jozy Altidore added another to put the United States in the lead in Group D. The 18-year-old Adu, a midfielder for Real Salt Lake who is in his fourth season in Major League Soccer, is playing in his third U-20 World Cup.
